{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Connecticut Huskies |Image= Uconnmenslogo.png |Conference=Big East Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big East |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=18–16 |ConfRecord=7–11 |HeadCoach=[[Jim Calhoun]] |AsstCoach1=[[George Blaney]] |AsstCoach2=Andre LaFleur |AsstCoach3=Patrick Sellers |StadiumArena=[[Harry A. Gampel Pavilion]]
[[XL Center]] |Champion= |BowlTourney=[[2010 National Invitation Tournament|NIT]] |BowlTourneyResult=Second Round }} {{2009–10 Big East men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Connecticut Huskies men's basketball team''' represented the [[University of Connecticut]] in the 2009â2010 [[NCAA Division I]] basketball season. The Huskies were coached by Jim Calhoun and played their home games at the [[XL Center]] in [[Hartford, Connecticut]], and on campus at the [[Harry A. Gampel Pavilion]] in [[Storrs, Connecticut]]. The Huskies are a member of the [[Big East Conference]]. They finished the season 18–16, 7–11 in Big East play and lost in the first round of the [[2010 Big East Men's Basketball Tournament]]. They were invited to the [[2010 National Invitation Tournament]] and advanced to the second round before losing to [[2009â10 Virginia Tech Hokies men's basketball team|Virginia Tech]]. ==Preseason== Senior Jerome Dyson and sophomore [[Kemba Walker]] were named to the All-BIG EAST Preseason Team while senior Stanley Robinson garnered All-BIG EAST Honorable Mention accolades. ===Roster changes=== UConn was hit hard due to the graduation of starters [[Jeff Adrien]], A.J. Price, and Craig Austrie. They were also without center [[Hasheem Thabeet]] who decided to enter the [[NBA]] at the end of the 2008-09 season. ===Recruiting class=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=no|collapse=no|year=2009}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Jamal Coombs-McDaniel | position = F | hometown = Boston, MA | highschool = Tilton School | feet = 6 | inches = 7 | weight = 197 | 40 = | commitdate = 10/01/06 | scout stars = 4 | rivals stars = 4 | espn grade = 94 }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Alex Oriahki | position = C | hometown = Lowell, MA | highschool = Tilton School | feet = 6 | inches = 8 | weight = 235 | 40 = | commitdate = 08/11/06 | scout stars = 5 | rivals stars = 5 | espn grade = 96 }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Darius Smith | position = G | hometown = Chicago, IL | highschool = Marshall Metropolitan HS | feet = 6 | inches = 2 | weight = 180 | 40 = | commitdate = 03/30/09 | scout stars = 4 | rivals stars = 4 | espn grade = 90 }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Jamaal Trice | position = G | hometown = Durham, NC | highschool = Mt.
